segment.source: MDUsing your Android device with Intune
segment.target: MDUsing your Android device with Intune

segment.source: Use these steps for tasks that you need to do on your Android device when your company is using Microsoft Intune:
segment.target: Use these steps for tasks that you need to do on your Android device when your company is using Microsoft Intune:

segment.source: Task category
segment.target: Task category

segment.source: Tasks you can do
segment.target: Tasks you can do

segment.target: Use managed apps on your device

segment.target: Set the amount of time before your device is locked

segment.target: Reset (erase) your lost or stolen device

segment.target: Turn off Microsoft usage data collection

segment.source: Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app
segment.target: Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app

segment.source: Fix issues with your device
segment.target: Fix issues with your device

segment.source: Use Verbose Logging to help your IT admin fix issues
segment.target: Use Verbose Logging to help your IT admin fix issues

segment.source: Send diagnostic data logs to your IT admin using email
segment.target: Send diagnostic data logs to your IT admin using email

segment.target: Send diagnostic data logs to your IT admin using a USB cable

segment.target: Send enrollment errors to your IT admin

segment.source: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version
segment.target: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version

segment.target: Device doesn't comply with the maximum operating system version

segment.source: Your device is rooted and you can't connect
segment.target: Your device is rooted and you can't connect

segment.source: Install the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app
segment.target: Install the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app

segment.source: The Company Portal is an app that you install on your device to give you access to your company or school apps, email, and network.
segment.target: The Company Portal is an app that you install on your device to give you access to your company or school apps, email, and network.

segment.source: Before you can get access, you have to install the Company Portal app, and then use the app to enroll your device in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Before you can get access, you have to install the Company Portal app, and then use the app to enroll your device in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To find out more about what enrolling means, see What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?.
segment.target: To find out more about what enrolling means, see What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?.

segment.source: Tap Home > Play Store.
segment.target: Tap Home > Play Store.

segment.source: In the Search box, type company portal.
segment.target: In the Search box, type company portal.

segment.source: Tap Intune Company Portal.
segment.target: Tap Intune Company Portal.

segment.source: Tap INSTALL.
segment.target: Tap INSTALL.

segment.source: Tap ACCEPT.
segment.target: Tap ACCEPT.

segment.source: Sign in to the Company Portal
segment.target: Sign in to the Company Portal

segment.source: After you install the Company Portal app, you'll need to sign in to the app to enroll your device in Intune.
segment.target: After you install the Company Portal app, you'll need to sign in to the app to enroll your device in Intune.

segment.source: Once you enroll, you can sign in to the Company Portal anytime to download company apps and do other tasks.
segment.target: Once you enroll, you can sign in to the Company Portal anytime to download company apps and do other tasks.

segment.source: For more about what you can do, see What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?.
segment.target: For more about what you can do, see What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?.

segment.source: Tap Company Portal in your list of apps.
segment.target: Tap Company Portal in your list of apps.

segment.source: On the Welcome screen, tap Sign in.
segment.target: On the Welcome screen, tap Sign in.

segment.source: Enter your work or school email and your password, and then Tap Sign in.
segment.target: Enter your work or school email and your password, and then Tap Sign in.

segment.source: If you are signing into the Company Portal app for the first time, and your company or school is using Intune, you will be prompted to enroll your device in Intune.
segment.target: If you are signing into the Company Portal app for the first time, and your company or school is using Intune, you will be prompted to enroll your device in Intune.

segment.source: To enroll, follow the steps in Enroll your device in Intune.
segment.target: To enroll, follow the steps in Enroll your device in Intune.

segment.source: For Android 6.0 or later devices only:
segment.target: For Android 6.0 or later devices only:

segment.source: When you sign in to the Company Portal app for the first time to enroll your device, you see the message, Allow Company Portal to make and manage phone calls?.
segment.target: When you sign in to the Company Portal app for the first time to enroll your device, you see the message, Allow Company Portal to make and manage phone calls?.

segment.source: This message is misleading, because Microsoft never makes or manages your phone calls!
segment.target: This message is misleading, because Microsoft never makes or manages your phone calls!

segment.source: Google controls the message text, so Microsoft cannot change it.
segment.target: Google controls the message text, so Microsoft cannot change it.

segment.source: When you allow access, all you're doing is allowing the Company Portal app to see your phone number and an ID called an IMEI.
segment.target: When you allow access, all you're doing is allowing the Company Portal app to see your phone number and an ID called an IMEI.

segment.source: If you deny access, the message will appear again the next time you sign in to the Company Portal, but you can turn off future messages by tapping the Never ask again check box.
segment.target: If you deny access, the message will appear again the next time you sign in to the Company Portal, but you can turn off future messages by tapping the Never ask again check box.

segment.source: If you later decide to allow access, go to Settings > Apps > Company Portal > Permissions > Phone, and then turn on the permission.
segment.target: If you later decide to allow access, go to Settings > Apps > Company Portal > Permissions > Phone, and then turn on the permission.

segment.source: Enroll your device in Intune
segment.target: Enroll your device in Intune

segment.source: When you enroll your device in Intune, you can access the company’s network, and get your work email, work files, and company apps.
segment.target: When you enroll your device in Intune, you can access the company’s network, and get your work email, work files, and company apps.

segment.source: To find out more about what you can do when you enroll, see What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?.
segment.target: To find out more about what you can do when you enroll, see What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?.

segment.source: If you have issues while trying to enroll, see Send enrollment errors to your IT admin.
segment.target: If you have issues while trying to enroll, see Send enrollment errors to your IT admin.

segment.source: To enroll, use the steps that match the type of device you have:
segment.target: To enroll, use the steps that match the type of device you have:

segment.source: Enroll your native (not a Samsung Knox) device in Intune
segment.target: Enroll your native (not a Samsung Knox) device in Intune

segment.source: Enroll your Samsung Knox device in Intune
segment.target: Enroll your Samsung Knox device in Intune

segment.source: Enroll your native (not a Samsung Knox) device in Intune
segment.target: Enroll your native (not a Samsung Knox) device in Intune

segment.source: The instructions for enrolling are different for a Samsung Knox Android device versus a "native," non-Samsung Knox Android device.
segment.target: The instructions for enrolling are different for a Samsung Knox Android device versus a "native," non-Samsung Knox Android device.

segment.source: To determine if you have a Samsung Knox device, go to Settings > About phone.
segment.target: To determine if you have a Samsung Knox device, go to Settings > About phone.

segment.source: If you don't see the word "Knox" listed there, follow these enrollment instructions.
segment.target: If you don't see the word "Knox" listed there, follow these enrollment instructions.

segment.source: On the Company Portal Welcome screen, tap Sign in, and then sign in with your work or school account.
segment.target: On the Company Portal Welcome screen, tap Sign in, and then sign in with your work or school account.

segment.source: If your IT admin set up company terms and conditions, tap ACCEPT to accept the terms.
segment.target: If your IT admin set up company terms and conditions, tap ACCEPT to accept the terms.

segment.source: Tap ENROLL.
segment.target: Tap ENROLL.

segment.source: Tap Activate.
segment.target: Tap Activate.

segment.source: Follow the prompts to enter a PIN or password.
segment.target: Follow the prompts to enter a PIN or password.

segment.source: If you already set up a PIN or password on this device, you won't see this screen or be required to enter a new PIN or password.
segment.target: If you already set up a PIN or password on this device, you won't see this screen or be required to enter a new PIN or password.

segment.source: On the Name the certificate screen, tap OK to accept the default certificate.
segment.target: On the Name the certificate screen, tap OK to accept the default certificate.

segment.source: Your device is now enrolled in Intune.
segment.target: Your device is now enrolled in Intune.

segment.source: If you get an error while trying to enroll your device in Intune, see Send enrollment errors to your IT admin.
segment.target: If you get an error while trying to enroll your device in Intune, see Send enrollment errors to your IT admin.

segment.source: Enroll your Samsung Knox device in Intune
segment.target: Enroll your Samsung Knox device in Intune

segment.source: To determine if you have a Samsung Knox device, go to Settings > About phone.
segment.target: To determine if you have a Samsung Knox device, go to Settings > About phone.

segment.source: If you see "Knox" listed there, you have a Samsung Knox device.
segment.target: If you see "Knox" listed there, you have a Samsung Knox device.

segment.source: On the Company Portal Welcome screen, tap Sign in, and then sign in with your work or school account.
segment.target: On the Company Portal Welcome screen, tap Sign in, and then sign in with your work or school account.

segment.source: If your IT admin set up company terms and conditions, tap ACCEPT to accept the terms.
segment.target: If your IT admin set up company terms and conditions, tap ACCEPT to accept the terms.

segment.source: Tap ENROLL.
segment.target: Tap ENROLL.

segment.source: Tap ACTIVATE.
segment.target: Tap ACTIVATE.

segment.source: Accept the Samsung Knox Privacy Policy and tap CONFIRM.
segment.target: Accept the Samsung Knox Privacy Policy and tap CONFIRM.

segment.source: Your device is now enrolled in Intune.
segment.target: Your device is now enrolled in Intune.

segment.source: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?
segment.target: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?

segment.source: You start by installing the Company Portal app, and then use the app to enroll your device in Intune.
segment.target: You start by installing the Company Portal app, and then use the app to enroll your device in Intune.

segment.source: Once your device is enrolled, you can use the Company Portal app to:
segment.target: Once your device is enrolled, you can use the Company Portal app to:

segment.source: Access the company network, email, and work files
segment.target: Access the company network, email, and work files

segment.source: Get company apps from the Company Portal app or Company Portal website
segment.target: Get company apps from the Company Portal app or Company Portal website

segment.source: Automatically configure your company email account
segment.target: Automatically configure your company email account

segment.source: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen
segment.target: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen

segment.source: When you enroll your device in Intune, you are giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.
segment.target: When you enroll your device in Intune, you are giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.

segment.source: What IT cannot see
segment.target: What IT cannot see

segment.source: Call history
segment.target: Call history

segment.source: Text messages
segment.target: Text messages

segment.source: Personal email, contacts, and calendar
segment.target: Personal email, contacts, and calendar

segment.source: Web history
segment.target: Web history

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Camera roll
segment.target: Camera roll

segment.source: Personal data
segment.target: Personal data

segment.source: What IT can see
segment.target: What IT can see

segment.source: Owner
segment.target: Owner

segment.source: Device name
segment.target: Device name

segment.source: Serial number
segment.target: Serial number

segment.source: Manufacturer
segment.target: Manufacturer

segment.source: Model
segment.target: Model

segment.source: Operating system
segment.target: Operating system

segment.source: Company apps
segment.target: Company apps

segment.source: Personal apps
segment.target: Personal apps

segment.source: When you add your Android device, you are giving your IT administrator permission to access the device.
segment.target: When you add your Android device, you are giving your IT administrator permission to access the device.

segment.source: They can do things like:
segment.target: They can do things like:

segment.source: Reset your device back to manufacturer’s defaults.
segment.target: Reset your device back to manufacturer’s defaults.

segment.source: This is helpful if the device is lost or stolen.
segment.target: This is helpful if the device is lost or stolen.

segment.source: Remove all company related data.
segment.target: Remove all company related data.

segment.source: Your personal data and settings aren’t removed.
segment.target: Your personal data and settings aren’t removed.

segment.source: Force you to have a password or PIN on the device, which may lock you out of the device, or reset your device back to manufacturer’s default settings, which may include the deletion of data, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.
segment.target: Force you to have a password or PIN on the device, which may lock you out of the device, or reset your device back to manufacturer’s default settings, which may include the deletion of data, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.

segment.source: Require you to accept terms and conditions.
segment.target: Require you to accept terms and conditions.

segment.source: Enable or disable the camera on your device.
segment.target: Enable or disable the camera on your device.

segment.source: Force all the data, including corporate and personal data, on the device to be encrypted.
segment.target: Force all the data, including corporate and personal data, on the device to be encrypted.

segment.source: This helps protect the data if the device is lost or stolen.
segment.target: This helps protect the data if the device is lost or stolen.

segment.source: After your device is added to the Company Portal, approximately every 8 hours it will:
segment.target: After your device is added to the Company Portal, approximately every 8 hours it will:

segment.source: Download any policy or app updates that your IT administrator has made available.
segment.target: Download any policy or app updates that your IT administrator has made available.

segment.source: Send any hardware inventory updates (these updates do not contain personal information).
segment.target: Send any hardware inventory updates (these updates do not contain personal information).

segment.source: Send any company app inventory updates (these updates do not contain personal information).
segment.target: Send any company app inventory updates (these updates do not contain personal information).

segment.source: What happens if I reset my Android device using the Company Portal?
segment.target: What happens if I reset my Android device using the Company Portal?

segment.source: When you use the Company Portal to reset your personal device, some apps and settings on your device may be deleted, including some of your personal data.
segment.target: When you use the Company Portal to reset your personal device, some apps and settings on your device may be deleted, including some of your personal data.

segment.source: What happens on each device depends on the type of device you have and how you are using the device, as described in the following table.
segment.target: What happens on each device depends on the type of device you have and how you are using the device, as described in the following table.

segment.source: Device configuration and management
segment.target: Device configuration and management

segment.source: Device type
segment.target: Device type

segment.source: Your IT admin manages your mobile device
segment.target: Your IT admin manages your mobile device

segment.source: Android
segment.target: Android

segment.source: When you reset your Android device, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.
segment.target: When you reset your Android device, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.

segment.source: Your device can access company email only
segment.target: Your device can access company email only

segment.source: Android
segment.target: Android

segment.source: When you reset your Android device, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s defaults.
segment.target: When you reset your Android device, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s defaults.

segment.source: All your personal data and settings will be removed.
segment.target: All your personal data and settings will be removed.

segment.source: What is the Company Portal website and what can I do with it?
segment.target: What is the Company Portal website and what can I do with it?

segment.source: The Company Portal website is your company’s web interface that you use to manage your work computers and devices, and your personal computers and devices that you choose to use at work.
segment.target: The Company Portal website is your company’s web interface that you use to manage your work computers and devices, and your personal computers and devices that you choose to use at work.

segment.source: You can do most of the same tasks on this website that you can do by using the Company Portal app that you install on your device.
segment.target: You can do most of the same tasks on this website that you can do by using the Company Portal app that you install on your device.

segment.source: You can do the following tasks from the Company Portal website:
segment.target: You can do the following tasks from the Company Portal website:

segment.source: Browse for and download company apps
segment.target: Browse for and download company apps

segment.source: Rename your device
segment.target: Rename your device

segment.source: Remove your device from Intune
segment.target: Remove your device from Intune

segment.source: Reset your mobile device to its factory default settings
segment.target: Reset your mobile device to its factory default settings

segment.source: Find contact information for your IT administrator
segment.target: Find contact information for your IT administrator

segment.source: Use managed apps on your device
segment.target: Use managed apps on your device

segment.source: Managed apps are apps that your IT administrator can configure to help protect company data that you can access in that app.
segment.target: Managed apps are apps that your IT administrator can configure to help protect company data that you can access in that app.

segment.source: When you access company data in a managed app, you may notice that the app works a little differently from what you expect.
segment.target: When you access company data in a managed app, you may notice that the app works a little differently from what you expect.

segment.source: For example, you might not be able to copy and paste protected company data, or you might not be able to save that data to certain locations.
segment.target: For example, you might not be able to copy and paste protected company data, or you might not be able to save that data to certain locations.

segment.source: Different managed apps can also work together on your device to allow you to do your daily tasks, while keeping corporate data protected.
segment.target: Different managed apps can also work together on your device to allow you to do your daily tasks, while keeping corporate data protected.

segment.source: For example, if you open a company file in one managed app, and another managed app is required to view that file, the managed app that allows you to view the file opens automatically.
segment.target: For example, if you open a company file in one managed app, and another managed app is required to view that file, the managed app that allows you to view the file opens automatically.

segment.source: If a required app is not available, certain actions, like opening a document or accessing a web link from within a managed document, might not be available.
segment.target: If a required app is not available, certain actions, like opening a document or accessing a web link from within a managed document, might not be available.

segment.source: When you access company data in a managed app, you see a message like the one below, which lets you know that the app you are opening is managed.
segment.target: When you access company data in a managed app, you see a message like the one below, which lets you know that the app you are opening is managed.

segment.source: How do I get managed apps?
segment.target: How do I get managed apps?

segment.source: You get managed apps in a couple of different ways:
segment.target: You get managed apps in a couple of different ways:

segment.source: When your device is enrolled in Microsoft Intune, you either install the app from your Company Portal app or Company Portal website, or your IT admin might install it on your device.
segment.target: When your device is enrolled in Microsoft Intune, you either install the app from your Company Portal app or Company Portal website, or your IT admin might install it on your device.

segment.source: To find out about enrollment, see Enroll your device in Intune.
segment.target: To find out about enrollment, see Enroll your device in Intune.

segment.source: You install an app from the Play Store and then sign in with your corporate user account that is managed by Intune.
segment.target: You install an app from the Play Store and then sign in with your corporate user account that is managed by Intune.

segment.source: What can my IT admin manage in an app?
segment.target: What can my IT admin manage in an app?

segment.source: Here are some examples of options that your IT admin can manage in an app and that can affect your interactions with company data on your device:
segment.target: Here are some examples of options that your IT admin can manage in an app and that can affect your interactions with company data on your device:

segment.source: Access to specific websites
segment.target: Access to specific websites

segment.source: Transfers of data between apps
segment.target: Transfers of data between apps

segment.source: Saving files
segment.target: Saving files

segment.source: Copy and paste operations
segment.target: Copy and paste operations

segment.source: PIN access requirements
segment.target: PIN access requirements

segment.source: Your login, using company credentials
segment.target: Your login, using company credentials

segment.source: Ability to back up to the cloud
segment.target: Ability to back up to the cloud

segment.source: Ability to take screenshots
segment.target: Ability to take screenshots

segment.source: Data encryption requirements
segment.target: Data encryption requirements

segment.source: Some common apps that your IT department might manage are:
segment.target: Some common apps that your IT department might manage are:

segment.source: Managed web browser
segment.target: Managed web browser

segment.source: Managed image viewer
segment.target: Managed image viewer

segment.source: Managed PDF viewer
segment.target: Managed PDF viewer

segment.source: Managed AV player
segment.target: Managed AV player

segment.source: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
segment.target: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint

segment.source: Contact your IT admin for more information about the managed apps on your device.
segment.target: Contact your IT admin for more information about the managed apps on your device.

segment.source: Encrypt your device
segment.target: Encrypt your device

segment.source: If your company or organization requires you to encrypt your device before you can access company files, email, or data, follow these steps to encrypt your device:
segment.target: If your company or organization requires you to encrypt your device before you can access company files, email, or data, follow these steps to encrypt your device:

segment.source: Ensure that your device is connected to the charger.
segment.target: Ensure that your device is connected to the charger.

segment.source: Tap Search.
segment.target: Tap Search.

segment.source: In the Search box, type company portal.
segment.target: In the Search box, type company portal.

segment.source: Ensure that a screen lock PIN or password has been set for your device.
segment.target: Ensure that a screen lock PIN or password has been set for your device.

segment.source: In Settings, click Security > Encrypt Phone.
segment.target: In Settings, click Security > Encrypt Phone.

segment.source: (On some phones, you’ll need to click Storage > Storage encryption).
segment.target: (On some phones, you’ll need to click Storage > Storage encryption).

segment.source: Follow the on-screen instructions.
segment.target: Follow the on-screen instructions.

segment.source: During encryption, your device might restart several times.
segment.target: During encryption, your device might restart several times.

segment.source: Ensure that your device is enrolled with Microsoft Intune by following the instructions in Enroll your device in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Ensure that your device is enrolled with Microsoft Intune by following the instructions in Enroll your device in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Set your PIN or password
segment.target: Set your PIN or password

segment.source: Tap Settings > Security > Screen Lock > Password.
segment.target: Tap Settings > Security > Screen Lock > Password.

segment.source: Choose and confirm your new password.
segment.target: Choose and confirm your new password.

segment.source: Ensure that your device is enrolled with Microsoft Intune by following the instructions in Enroll your device in Intune.
segment.target: Ensure that your device is enrolled with Microsoft Intune by following the instructions in Enroll your device in Intune.

segment.source: Tap GET > INSTALL.
segment.target: Tap GET > INSTALL.

segment.source: Install your company's Virtual Private Network (VPN)
segment.target: Install your company's Virtual Private Network (VPN)

segment.source: If your IT administrator has configured a VPN application to enable you to connect to your company's resources, you'll see a notification on your device indicating that you need to install a VPN app.
segment.target: If your IT administrator has configured a VPN application to enable you to connect to your company's resources, you'll see a notification on your device indicating that you need to install a VPN app.

segment.source: Follow these steps to install the VPN app:
segment.target: Follow these steps to install the VPN app:

segment.source: Pull down the notification drawer, and tap Tap to install this required app.
segment.target: Pull down the notification drawer, and tap Tap to install this required app.

segment.source: In the Play Store, click INSTALL and follow the prompts to install the app.
segment.target: In the Play Store, click INSTALL and follow the prompts to install the app.

segment.source: Tap Install corporate VPN profile and follow the prompts to accept and activate the app.
segment.target: Tap Install corporate VPN profile and follow the prompts to accept and activate the app.

segment.source: Set the amount of time before your device is locked
segment.target: Set the amount of time before your device is locked

segment.source: In Settings on your device, click Security > Automatically Lock (this appears as Lock phone after on some devices).
segment.target: In Settings on your device, click Security > Automatically Lock (this appears as Lock phone after on some devices).

segment.source: Specify the password timeout value.
segment.target: Specify the password timeout value.

segment.source: Ensure that your device is enrolled with by following the instructions in Enroll your device in Intune.
segment.target: Ensure that your device is enrolled with by following the instructions in Enroll your device in Intune.

segment.source: Reset (erase) your lost or stolen device
segment.target: Reset (erase) your lost or stolen device

segment.source: If your phone is lost or stolen, you can reset it to factory defaults.
segment.target: If your phone is lost or stolen, you can reset it to factory defaults.

segment.source: Resetting a device to factor defaults removes both your personal and work information from it.
segment.target: Resetting a device to factor defaults removes both your personal and work information from it.

segment.source: Open portal.manage.microsoft.com in your browser, and sign in to your work account.
segment.target: Open portal.manage.microsoft.com in your browser, and sign in to your work account.

segment.source: Tap My Devices and select the name of the lost of stolen device.
segment.target: Tap My Devices and select the name of the lost of stolen device.

segment.source: Click Reset > Reset.
segment.target: Click Reset > Reset.

segment.source: If you are unable to reset your lost or stolen device, ask your IT administrator to reset it for you.
segment.target: If you are unable to reset your lost or stolen device, ask your IT administrator to reset it for you.

segment.source: Turn off Microsoft usage data collection
segment.target: Turn off Microsoft usage data collection

segment.source: In order to improve its products and services, Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the reliability and performance of the Company Portal app and how it is used.
segment.target: In order to improve its products and services, Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the reliability and performance of the Company Portal app and how it is used.

segment.source: You can turn off the collection of that data by using the Usage Data setting in the Company Portal app.
segment.target: You can turn off the collection of that data by using the Usage Data setting in the Company Portal app.

segment.source: IT administrators have no control over the collection of the data, and they cannot change your selection for the setting.
segment.target: IT administrators have no control over the collection of the data, and they cannot change your selection for the setting.

segment.source: Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app
segment.target: Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app

segment.source: When you unenroll your device from Intune, your device will no longer be able to access company resources.
segment.target: When you unenroll your device from Intune, your device will no longer be able to access company resources.

segment.source: For more about what happens when you unenroll, see What happens when you unenroll your device from Intune?.
segment.target: For more about what happens when you unenroll, see What happens when you unenroll your device from Intune?.

segment.source: To unenroll your device from Intune and uninstall the Company Portal app:
segment.target: To unenroll your device from Intune and uninstall the Company Portal app:

segment.source: Sign in to the Company Portal app.
segment.target: Sign in to the Company Portal app.

segment.source: Tap MY DEVICES and then select the device you want to unenroll.
segment.target: Tap MY DEVICES and then select the device you want to unenroll.

segment.source: Tap the trash can icon.
segment.target: Tap the trash can icon.

segment.source: On the warning page, tap OK to unenroll your device.
segment.target: On the warning page, tap OK to unenroll your device.

segment.source: Unenroll your device from Intune if you declined Terms of Use
segment.target: Unenroll your device from Intune if you declined Terms of Use

segment.source: Use these instructions to unenroll from Intune only if you declined the Terms of Use while trying to sign in to the Company Portal app.
segment.target: Use these instructions to unenroll from Intune only if you declined the Terms of Use while trying to sign in to the Company Portal app.

segment.source: When you decline the Terms, you cannot sign in to the Company Portal app.
segment.target: When you decline the Terms, you cannot sign in to the Company Portal app.

segment.source: To unenroll your device, you generally use the Company Portal app, so these instructions are a workaround method for unenrolling when you have declined the Terms.
segment.target: To unenroll your device, you generally use the Company Portal app, so these instructions are a workaround method for unenrolling when you have declined the Terms.

segment.source: The best way to unenroll your device is to accept the Terms, sign in to the Company Portal app, and then unenroll.
segment.target: The best way to unenroll your device is to accept the Terms, sign in to the Company Portal app, and then unenroll.

segment.source: See Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app.
segment.target: See Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app.

segment.source: When you uninstall the Company Portal app, you are also unenrolling your device from Intune, which means that your device will no longer be able to access company resources.
segment.target: When you uninstall the Company Portal app, you are also unenrolling your device from Intune, which means that your device will no longer be able to access company resources.

segment.source: For more about what happens when you unenroll, see What happens when you unenroll your device from Intune?.
segment.target: For more about what happens when you unenroll, see What happens when you unenroll your device from Intune?.

segment.source: Before you can uninstall the Company Portal app, you have to go to the Device administrators setting, and turn off Company Portal.
segment.target: Before you can uninstall the Company Portal app, you have to go to the Device administrators setting, and turn off Company Portal.

segment.source: The steps may differ a little, depending on which Android device you have.
segment.target: The steps may differ a little, depending on which Android device you have.

segment.source: To unenroll your device from Intune and uninstall the Company Portal app:
segment.target: To unenroll your device from Intune and uninstall the Company Portal app:

segment.source: Go to Settings > Security & Screen Lock > Device administrators.
segment.target: Go to Settings > Security & Screen Lock > Device administrators.

segment.source: Completing this step immediately unenrolls your device.
segment.target: Completing this step immediately unenrolls your device.

segment.source: Clear the check box next to, or turn off, Company Portal.
segment.target: Clear the check box next to, or turn off, Company Portal.

segment.source: You can now uninstall the Company Portal app.
segment.target: You can now uninstall the Company Portal app.

segment.source: What happens when you unenroll your device from Intune?
segment.target: What happens when you unenroll your device from Intune?

segment.source: For instructions on how to unenroll, see Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app.
segment.target: For instructions on how to unenroll, see Unenroll your device from Intune by using the Company Portal app.

segment.source: When you unenroll your device from Intune:
segment.target: When you unenroll your device from Intune:

segment.source: Your device won’t appear in the Company Portal anymore.
segment.target: Your device won’t appear in the Company Portal anymore.

segment.source: You can’t install apps from the Company Portal anymore.
segment.target: You can’t install apps from the Company Portal anymore.

segment.source: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.
segment.target: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.

segment.source: You might not have access to some company resources, such as file shares or internal web sites, on your device anymore.
segment.target: You might not have access to some company resources, such as file shares or internal web sites, on your device anymore.

segment.source: If your device is set up only to get company email, and you unenroll your device, your device won't appear in the Company Portal anymore.
segment.target: If your device is set up only to get company email, and you unenroll your device, your device won't appear in the Company Portal anymore.

segment.source: Fix issues with your device
segment.target: Fix issues with your device

segment.source: Use this information to fix issues with your device when you're trying to install the Company Portal app, enroll your device in Intune, or if you've already enrolled in Intune.
segment.target: Use this information to fix issues with your device when you're trying to install the Company Portal app, enroll your device in Intune, or if you've already enrolled in Intune.

segment.source: Use Verbose Logging to help your IT admin fix issues
segment.target: Use Verbose Logging to help your IT admin fix issues

segment.source: When your device is enrolled in Intune, you can use the Verbose Logging setting to make the Company Portal app and Intune-managed apps record detailed logs about what's happening on your device.
segment.target: When your device is enrolled in Intune, you can use the Verbose Logging setting to make the Company Portal app and Intune-managed apps record detailed logs about what's happening on your device.

segment.source: These logs help your IT admin fix any issues that you might have when you're using the Company Portal or an app that's managed by Intune.
segment.target: These logs help your IT admin fix any issues that you might have when you're using the Company Portal or an app that's managed by Intune.

segment.source: Verbose Logging is enabled on your device by default, and the logs that are sent to your IT admin include your email address.
segment.target: Verbose Logging is enabled on your device by default, and the logs that are sent to your IT admin include your email address.

segment.source: To turn Verbose Logging on or off, sign in to the Company Portal app using your work or school credentials, tap Settings, and tap the on/off button next to the Verbose Logging setting.
segment.target: To turn Verbose Logging on or off, sign in to the Company Portal app using your work or school credentials, tap Settings, and tap the on/off button next to the Verbose Logging setting.

segment.source: Send diagnostic data logs to your IT admin using email
segment.target: Send diagnostic data logs to your IT admin using email

segment.source: If you get an error while you're working with your school or company apps or while you're in the Company Portal app, you can send diagnostic data logs to help your IT admin figure out and fix the error.
segment.target: If you get an error while you're working with your school or company apps or while you're in the Company Portal app, you can send diagnostic data logs to help your IT admin figure out and fix the error.

segment.source: To include all of the details in the logs, which will make it easier for your IT admin to figure out the issue, turn on Verbose Logging.
segment.target: To include all of the details in the logs, which will make it easier for your IT admin to figure out the issue, turn on Verbose Logging.

segment.source: Open the Company Portal app.
segment.target: Open the Company Portal app.

segment.source: Tap Menu > Settings.
segment.target: Tap Menu > Settings.

segment.source: Menu could be a software button or a hardware button, depending on the type of Android device you have.
segment.target: Menu could be a software button or a hardware button, depending on the type of Android device you have.

segment.source: Under Diagnostic Data, tap Send Data.
segment.target: Under Diagnostic Data, tap Send Data.

segment.source: If you're using Android 6.0 or later devices only: When you tap Send Data, you see the message, Allow Company Portal to access photos, media, and files on your device?.
segment.target: If you're using Android 6.0 or later devices only: When you tap Send Data, you see the message, Allow Company Portal to access photos, media, and files on your device?.

segment.source: This message is misleading, because Microsoft never accesses the photos, media, or files on your device!
segment.target: This message is misleading, because Microsoft never accesses the photos, media, or files on your device!

segment.source: Google controls the message text, so Microsoft cannot change it.
segment.target: Google controls the message text, so Microsoft cannot change it.

segment.source: When you allow access, all you're doing is allowing your device to write data logs to the device's SD card, which enables you to move those logs by using a USB cable.
segment.target: When you allow access, all you're doing is allowing your device to write data logs to the device's SD card, which enables you to move those logs by using a USB cable.

segment.source: If you deny access, the message will appear again the next time you tap Send Data, but you can turn off future messages by tapping the Never ask again check box.
segment.target: If you deny access, the message will appear again the next time you tap Send Data, but you can turn off future messages by tapping the Never ask again check box.

segment.source: If you later decide to allow access, go to Settings > Apps > Company Portal > Permissions > Storage, and then turn on the permission.
segment.target: If you later decide to allow access, go to Settings > Apps > Company Portal > Permissions > Storage, and then turn on the permission.

segment.source: Follow the prompts to choose an email app to use for sending the logs to your IT admin.
segment.target: Follow the prompts to choose an email app to use for sending the logs to your IT admin.

segment.source: The app will create a pre-addressed email with all the logs attached.
segment.target: The app will create a pre-addressed email with all the logs attached.

segment.source: Send diagnostic data logs to your IT admin using a USB cable
segment.target: Send diagnostic data logs to your IT admin using a USB cable

segment.source: If you're using a computer rather than a mobile device, and you want to send data logs to have your IT admin figure out and fix your issue, use these steps:
segment.target: If you're using a computer rather than a mobile device, and you want to send data logs to have your IT admin figure out and fix your issue, use these steps:

segment.source: Before you start, make sure that you have your IT admin's email address.
segment.target: Before you start, make sure that you have your IT admin's email address.

segment.source: It is typically listed on your Company Portal website or in your Company Portal app.
segment.target: It is typically listed on your Company Portal website or in your Company Portal app.

segment.source: Use a USB cable to connect your device to a computer.
segment.target: Use a USB cable to connect your device to a computer.

segment.source: On the computer, look for a directory that has the name of your phone.
segment.target: On the computer, look for a directory that has the name of your phone.

segment.source: In that directory, find <Android Device>\Phone\Android\data\com.microsoft.windowsintune.companyportal\files\.
segment.target: In that directory, find <Android Device>\Phone\Android\data\com.microsoft.windowsintune.companyportal\files\.

segment.source: Attach all of the files to an email and send them to your IT admin.
segment.target: Attach all of the files to an email and send them to your IT admin.

segment.source: Send enrollment errors to your IT admin
segment.target: Send enrollment errors to your IT admin

segment.source: If you get an error while trying to enroll your device in Intune, you can try enrolling again by tapping Retry, or send the error information to your IT admin in an email by tapping Send info.
segment.target: If you get an error while trying to enroll your device in Intune, you can try enrolling again by tapping Retry, or send the error information to your IT admin in an email by tapping Send info.

segment.source: An email, addressed to your IT administrator, is automatically created and contains the logs that your IT admin needs to help troubleshoot your device.
segment.target: An email, addressed to your IT administrator, is automatically created and contains the logs that your IT admin needs to help troubleshoot your device.

segment.source: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version
segment.target: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version

segment.source: Your device doesn’t meet the minimum operating system version required by your IT department.
segment.target: Your device doesn’t meet the minimum operating system version required by your IT department.

segment.source: Before updating your device, check the current operating system version by tapping Settings > About phone, and then check to see if an update is available for your device by tapping Settings, and then finding the update option.
segment.target: Before updating your device, check the current operating system version by tapping Settings > About phone, and then check to see if an update is available for your device by tapping Settings, and then finding the update option.

segment.source: Device doesn't comply with the maximum operating system version
segment.target: Device doesn't comply with the maximum operating system version

segment.source: Your device does not comply with your IT admin's policy for the maximum version of the operating system.
segment.target: Your device does not comply with your IT admin's policy for the maximum version of the operating system.

segment.source: Contact your IT admin for help.
segment.target: Contact your IT admin for help.

segment.source: Your device is rooted and you can't connect
segment.target: Your device is rooted and you can't connect

segment.source: When your device is rooted, it means that your device has been changed to enable certain capabilities that could compromise company resources and security.
segment.target: When your device is rooted, it means that your device has been changed to enable certain capabilities that could compromise company resources and security.

segment.source: When your device is rooted, you cannot access company resources and must contact your IT admin to help you reconnect to company resources.
segment.target: When your device is rooted, you cannot access company resources and must contact your IT admin to help you reconnect to company resources.
